examples: Sketching is always a peltable or mobable offence, as being contrary to the Koran, and sitting down tempts the pelter.

entries.meaning: (sometimes figurative) A pelting; a shower of missiles, rain, anger, etc.
(dated) A pinchpenny; a mean, sordid person; a miser; a skinflint.

verbs.description: pelter (third-person singular simple present pelters, present participle peltering, simple past and past participle peltered)

examples: A person is "peltered" when he is subjected to a shower of stones, a shower of hail-stones, or a shower of anything. "Naay, gi'e ower peltering — one at a time! that's enew."
